title: When will 600 million people in India have received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine?
preds: They are having  The World's Largest Vaccination Driveon 14.09.2021, and with that number estimated for the first dose, would still take time to administrate.

Now at 603.6M. 
I'm sure this question will be closed imminently.

As of September 18th, 2021,  Our World In Data ran by the University of Oxford estimated that roughly 594,205,296 million people in India have at least received one dose of the COVID-19 vaccination. That number is up from 586,105,233 from September 17th, 2021. That is a 11,100,063 million number increase. With this information, I would forecast that by 9/21/2021 India will reach at least 600 million of their citizens having at least 1 dose of the COVID-19 Vaccination.
4m in 6 days, seems like a walk in the park.
25 m in 10 days. Looks overwhelmingly likely now.

570.5m with 10 days until Sept 24.
This needs a rate of 3m per day.
30m added on 6 days which is 5m per day, well ahead of 24 sept
30 m needed in 10 days. So far, the vaccination rate this month has been 5+ m/day. (About 73 m in 14 days).
as Delta wave subsides, and with potential shortages/distribution, daily rate of vaccination may decline

SEP, 12 - 561
SEP, 04 - 520
AUG27 - 473
AUG19 - 440
pace 5.125/day - 19SEP
3,0/day SEP, 25
~41M to go and 7 day avg is 5.4m. Should resolve to Bin 2 with a few days to spare
44 m in 14 days, seems eminently doable

Needs to be above 3.5m/day avg to come in before Sept 25, which it's been almost entirely for the last month, and the last 2 weeks have averaged significantly above that. Barring disaster it looks like this question is in the bag.

I refer to „ https://ourworldindata.org/covid-vaccinations?country=IND“. 09.08.21 ≈ 400 millions 1. dose; 08.09.21 ≈ 543 mil. 1. dose; 543-400 ≈ 143 1. dose by 30 days; 143 / 30 ≈ 4.76 mil. doses / day ; 600-543 = 57 mil. / 4.76 mil. / day ≈ 12 days ; 9. Sep + 12 days = 21. September. I expect that 600 millions Indians will have been given first dose by 21. September 2021 due to statistical data due to source above.
16 days through Sept 24. 56.538M to go. Need to add 3.53M/day to get to 600M in bin 2. Recent rates have been well above that.
54 m in 15 days, Sep rate ~ 5 m/day. The odds are getting better and better...

540.5m.  37.2m added in 7 days, which is 5.3m per day
59.5m to go at 5.5m per day is 11 days or 19 sept
For 24 sept to be reached rate needs to decrease to 3.9m per day
lesson: don't make an initial forecast if you don't want to put in the effort :-/ not only do i have covid fatigue, i may also have covid forecast fatigue....
60 m in 16 days. Ongoing Sep rate ~ 5.5 m/day.
India closing in on the target...

Rolling 10-day av. is still over 5M, even with the odd low day over the past week. And for every day we are above 3.85M (av. needed to reach 600M before 24th September), the average required will drop further. This looks much more achievable than it did a couple of weeks ago.

525,319,361 as of Sept 5. 7 day avg of 5.31M. 19 days to go means needs to be over 4.15M/day. Which is has been mostly above for the last month. It's either looking good or my score is about to take a dive...
80 million more and 20 days to go. Slightly more likely than unlikely.
Vaccine dose rate looks to be increasing.
India is good chasing targets (cricket analogy).... current run rate - for the last month or so ~ 7m/day.
6.6M/day added in the past week. 90.3M to go to reach 600M as of Sep 1. 23 more days to go to Sep 24. 3.9M/day needed to reach 600M by Sep 24. I think theyr'e going to make it.
If India can keep up the Aug rate (~ 4m/day), then 600m is possible before Sep 24. Which then makes it a touch & go and hence the odds need refinement in the next few days.

503.3m.  Looks like 10m additional yesterday which is a substantial increase in rates.
96.7m to go If this continues at 10m per day this is 10 days and we’ll before sept 24.
In the 7 days since my last forecast 42.5m additional shots were given which is an average of 7m per day
Using this 7m as the forecast for the next few days means 14 days until reaching 600m, which is before sept 24.

It took them 24 days to do the last 100 million. There are 107 million people left. But the rate looks like it may have increased in the past few days. I think it'll be very close, but I'm slightly favoring before September 24th. https://ourworldindata.org/explorers/coronavirus-data-explorer?zoomToSelection=true&time=2021-05-29..latest&facet=none&pickerSort=asc&pickerMetric=location&Metric=People+vaccinated&Interval=7-day+rolling+average&Relative+to+Population=false&Align+outbreaks=false&country=~IND

The rate at which people are receiving their first dose has gone up over the past week to 5.8M/day. Total 493.08M as of Aug. 30. 106.92M more to go to reach 600M. 25 days to go to Sept 24. Rate must be >= 4.28M/day to reach 600M by Sept. 24. Just when I had given up hope, the rate has finally increased. I'll give it a chance again. The Brier gods are always trying to teach me a lesson, I think. So, can this rate of 5.8M/day be kept up?

vaccination rate is so variable but the trend in 7 day averages is positive
Govt has confidence that most adults will have first dose by October
National supplies are increasing, supplies to states have been boosted because all teachers must have at least first dose before school returns early in September
Lots of positivity that this will be reached and the numbers look right but it will be teetering close to the mark. 
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/most-of-adults-will-get-1-dose-by-october/articleshow/85784957.cms

476,059,071 as of Aug 27. 7 day avg 4.28M but still volatile. 28 days to go and avg needs to be over 4.43M/day to beat Sept 24, which is on par with last update. Still very possible so I'm sticking with an optimistic forecast.
Still a slim chance of bin2

I am forecasting 28th September - 8th October, and expecting within 3 days of 3rd October.
I can't see it falling outside these dates due to the limited time frame remaining.

UPDATE Reasoning Base rate
- Aug 24th: 440 m 1st vaccinations since start of vaccination campaign on January 16th
- Worst case: Roll out with average no of 1st vaccinations between Junuary 16th and today = 2 m vaccinations per day. In that case, it would take India at least 80 days to reach the 600 m, even if all shots were 1st shots -> November 12th. If only 50% of shots were 1st shots, it would take them 160 days (year 2022)
- Current high, BBC, Aug 19th: 8.8 m doses administered in 1 day. Assumption: 50% first doses. If it stays on that level: 36 days -> September 27th
- Vaccinations week before last week: 37 m, week 5 weeks ago: 29 m -> trend upwards. If number is kept and 50% first vaccinations: 60 days -> October 23rd Specific information:
- BBC, Aug 19th: In June, the federal government told the Supreme Court that 1.35 billion doses will become available between August and December. It would take about 1.8 billion doses to vaccinate all eligible adults in India
-> Avg of 337 m shots per months
- ~330 m people in India are only vaccinated once and will need a second shot in the upcoming weeks/months. In other countries, this significantly slowed the vaccination of completely unvaccinated people
-> 330 m shots equal 1 month of available shots according to government.
-> Their vaccinations can be stretched to max. 12 weeks after the first vaccination but the clock started ticking for many of them weeks ago. So it can be assumed, that many of them will receive their second shot soon
- The uptick in recent vaccination numbers gives hope that more shots will be administered per day in the future

With only 31 days left before Sep 24, India would give 4.6M people/day a first dose. Bin 2 just keeps getting further out of reach.
With 143M to go, for 600M to be reached by Oct 18, an average of only 2.6M/day need to receive a first dose. With recent rates of >4M/day, 600M by Oct. will be achieved.

460.8m.  4.4m additional yesterday, so rates are higher.
139.2m to go 24 sept = 30 days = 4.64m per day
18 Oct = 54 days = 2.58m per day Looks like definitely before Oct 18, but depends on average for before 24 sept. Since my last forecast 4 days ago the number has increase from 447.3m to 460.8m.  This is 13.5m in 4 days = 3.3m per day
Since forecast on 11 Aug, 14 days ago, the number has increase from 403.6m to 460.8m.  This is 57.2m in 14 days = 4m per day Assuming the rates continue roughly on these lines then before 24 sept is unlikely.

The big push that india did to increase the number of vaccinations seems to have failed and the 7 day average has dropped back down to the low levels of the start of the month. if the rest of this week does not lift then I will drop a bit further.
I cannot find any published reason for the drop in vaccination again. It is just the weekends that are letting them down because the week days are nearly at the daily level required to get there

India approved a DNA vaccine for age 12 and up but overall the supply of this vaccine doesn't sound like it's substantial yet, they say around 100 to 120 million doses annually and it's a 3 dose vaccine. So I don't think it's going to have much effect on this question. Narrowing in on the early October bucket. https://www.straitstimes.com/asia/south-asia/india-approves-first-dna-based-covid-19-shot-boosting-vaccine-plan

last 3 days have been very low and while I am expecting a high reported vaccination day tomorrow I am worried that I have over estimated the increasing trend
I am struggling to find any good up to date info on why this is happening. I am hoping it is just lax reporting over the weekend but have reduced my probabilities just in case

I think we may reach 26th Sep, but 24th looks just our of reach given the number of days left. As each few days ticks by the av./day needs to increase further to reach bin2.

The manufacturing, supply and distribution issues suffered by India seem more likely to ease than to worsen over time, partly through initiatives such as CEPI (Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations) aiding COVAX rollout, but also as the wealthier countries increase their own immunity levels they seem more able to recognise all the associated benefits of helping other nations with their own vaccine rollouts.
The highest month for India to date looks like June at ~105M doses, and recent weeks look to be approaching this level again. I'm assuming a marginal increase over the next month being maintained into September, but allowing for it to increase a little more quickly towards October if bottlenecks improve, resulting in 460-465M end of August, and 565-595M by end of September.

Rethinking. Bin 2 should not be ruled out. 222M left to go to reach 600M. 52 days from Aug 3 to Sep 24. 222M/52 d = 4.27M/day. Over the past week, 4.11M/day have been given. The government has overpromised vaccine supplies, but with even slight increases, which seem likely, 600M could be reached by Sept. 24.

Over the past 31 days, an average of 3.09M people/day have been added. 4.11M/day added in the past week. Total 378.09M as of 8/3. 76 days to Oct. 18. 378.09M + 76*3.09M = 612.93M. Vaccine supplies seem to become available in bursts, but nonetheless, this is making me more optimistic about bin 3.

I still keep hoping they'll be able to increase supply and increase the pace of vaccination, but I'm adding more weight to bin 4. It's too close for me to call bin 3 vs. 4 right now.

In order to answer this question, we can look toward other nations that have similar economies and similar population densities as India, such as Brazil. For Brazil, it seems as if their rate has almost quadratically increased, which is close to the structure at the beginning of the logistic curve. A logistic curve is generally used to model the spread of a disease (see SIR models), and seems reasonable here since although there is an acceleration of vaccines at the beginning, but will slow down near the end due to less people available to vaccinate, and the accessibility issues.  A good baseline to start with is how long it took for Brazil to vaccinate 93M people because that is roughly the same percentage of people vaccinated as if India were to vaccinate 600M people. This took 155 days according to: https://graphics.reuters.com/world-coronavirus-tracker-and-maps/countries-and-territories/brazil/. If we were to look at 155 days after the first time India truly started administering vaccines at a widespread level, it would be around mid-September. Now to change this baseline, we have to think about factors specific to India. First, if we look at the the graph of **percentage of population** vaccinated, it is much slower than Brazil. If we adjust for this, it ends up being more mid-October. Furthermore, there are news of supply shortages of vaccines and concerns related to this have also pushed projections even lower. I hinge the probability of only 30% of the population getting vaccinated per this link: (https://scroll.in/latest/995465/covid-india-will-vaccinate-only-33-of-population-by-end-of-2021-in-current-scenario-predicts-imf) on the probability that the 5 vaccines that are yet to be approved are actually approved to be administered in India. In expectation, let us say that only 2.5 of the 5 remaining vaccines are approved, and making the rate about 5.5/8 of the current rate of vaccination percentage, the projected date becomes late october to mid-november.

This has been stable for last month and is reasonably linear.
Gap = 278 mill / 3.26 mill/day = 85 days
Forecast date to reach 600 mill is 2021/07/18 + 85 days = 2021/10/21 Data source:
https://ourworldindata.org/explorers/coronavirus-data-explorer?zoomToSelection=true&time=2020-03-01..latest&pickerSort=asc&pickerMetric=location&Metric=People+vaccinated&Interval=Cumulative&Relative+to+Population=false&Align+outbreaks=false&country=AUS~NZL~CAN~USA~GBR~DEU~IND

They're doing a little more than a 100 million a month currently. According to other sources I think they have the supply to keep that trend going or even increase it soon. Currently around 316 million, so the trend would put them hitting 600 million in 2.5 months or so, so end of September or early October. So I'm focusing on the middle bucket with plenty of probability given to the later buckets since 600 million is around 63% of the adult population so vaccine hesitancy may slow the rate.

Mean Vaccination rate in July (1st to 16th) is 2,461,494 with a std dev of 178,232. If nothing changes, applying 2 sigma confidence interval, there is a 97% probability to reach 600 Mn single dose vaccinations between 24th October 2021 and 27th November 2021. Even this rate is on average reducing by ~23k fewer first doses per day India's top 16% of population (by demographics of income) is easier to get vaccinated which is about 218 million people ( I would suspect this has a major role to play in the already vaccinated people). So the next 300 million would have resistance of taking days (off work) to get vaccine (since they can't afford non-pay days). [1] Vaccination requires downloading app, that not alot of people know how to do. So it can be safely assumed that the current spike is mostly of people who are tech savvy. Ref (https://fortune.com/2021/07/14/india-covid-vaccine-booking-digital-divide-cowin-app/)
[2] Vaccine manufacturing delays (https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-56345591)
[3] Vaccine shortages and expected procurement between Aug and December 2021 (https://www.deccanherald.com/national/india-orders-66-crore-covid-vaccines-amid-warnings-over-shortages-1009253.html)
[4] India Demographics data by income (https://www.imrg.org/india-demographics/)
[5] India literacy rate (63%) (https://censusindia.gov.in/census_and_you/literacy_and_level_of_education.aspx)
[6] Misinformation and mobile app causing gender disparity in vaccination (https://www.reuters.com/world/india/women-falling-behind-indias-covid-19-vaccination-drive-2021-06-08/) Points that can accelerate vaccine delivery
[1] Serum insitute increased pace of vaccine prodcution (https://www.livemint.com/news/india/serum-institute-to-ramp-up-covid-vaccine-production-to-over-11-cr-month-centre-11622115848392.html)
[2] Government considering incentives for covid vaccination (https://www.india.com/business/modi-government-must-provide-incentives-to-covid-vaccine-makers-to-increase-production-in-india-suggests-ficci-4581847/) Days between 5% increase in 1st dose vaccination by countries data:
Country | 10% to 15%  to 20%  to 25%  to 30% to 35%  to 40%  to 45%  to 50%  to 55%
US.         |          19     |     12      |   10.      |    10.   |     9     |       8      |     16     |     21    |      36
Israel.    |          4        |       4     |     10     |       7    |      7    |        8.    |       7   |         8     |      13
India.     |          34     |      17 There is evidence that the number of days between next 5% almost doubles after vaccine hesitancy is reached.

Based on the 30 days up to July 14, 600M would be reached on Oct. 2. Vaccine administration has been erratic due to supply shortages but has generally been increasing. If vaccine administration increases by an average of 11% over the next 2.5 months, 600M will be reached by Sept. 24. I am assigning a high probability to bin 2 and a low probability to bin 4 because I think improvements in increasing vaccine supplies, on average, will be more likely than more severe delays.

318,665,226 As of July 17. ~2.85M/day at 7 day avg. 7 day avg has been erratic over the last month ranging between 5.5M on June 26 and 2.6M on July 6, which would seem to confirm supply issues. "Manish Sisodia, the deputy chief minister of Delhi, tweeted that “vaccines have run out in Delhi again. The central government gives vaccines for a day or two, then we have to keep the vaccine centres closed for several days.” https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/jul/13/india-covid-vaccine-rollout-hit-by-hesitancy-and-supply-snags.  It seems at present no more than ~3M/day (1st dose) can be credibly expected with intermittent surges, so I'm thinking 3.5-3.7M as a trend over the term of the question? "In June, the federal government told the Supreme Court that 1.35 billion doses will become available between August and December." https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-56345591 This sounds plausible but I think it should be taken with a grain of salt. That said: "A new initiative aims to overcome bottlenecks that have hampered the production and global rollout of Covid-19 shots, linking manufacturers with suppliers of vital materials. The platform, led by the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations, will serve as a marketplace that matches up buyers and sellers of filters, lipids, vials, bioreactor bags and other key supplies used to make vaccines. 'What we’re actually seeing is manufacturers unable to deliver the vaccines that they were promising just because of one small thing like a filter' " https://www.bnnbloomberg.ca/covid-vaccine-makers-take-aim-at-bottlenecks-to-speed-production-1.1629217 So there is hope for accelerated production, and India likely plans to benefit more than most from this initiative. So lets say they do 3M/day for a month, +10% for the odd jump, then 4M/day after that. There are 69 days until Sept 24 and that would mean ~575 as of then. Despite seemingly high hesitancy that's less that half the population so it shouldn't be a significant factor in reaching 600M. It seems most likely to fall between the 25th and 18th, so I'll go heaviest in that, but they've shown they can accelerate too, so it may creep in just ahead, although not the most likely scenario.

Current first-dose rates won't hit the target until mid November. I guess a ramp-up is possible, but also disruptions/supply chain issues seem equally (if not more) likely, given how rollouts have gone worlwide.

Line draws to 2021-09-24 and 600 million. We can basically discount it coming in before then given how well it matches the curve and how these curves tend to turn in a sideways direction above 40% of the population. Adding some slight hedge in case it overshoots. https://cafebedouin.files.wordpress.com/2021/07/covid-ww-owid-india-vaccinations-2021-07-16-1.png

600M => 44% of population. Not likely to hit vaccine hesitancy by then. In the US, people with at least one dose started to slow down a bit after 40%, and the rate slowed very slightly after 40% in Germany, but to my knowledge, no other country has slowed down before somewhere between 45% to 62% was reached.
108M more people have received at least one dose in the past 30 days, or an average of 3.60M/day. Total currently at 313.5M, as of July 14.
One would hope that vaccination could proceed at at least the current pace, if not faster. At the same average pace as that seen in the last month, 600M would be reached in ((600M-313.5M)/3.60M) days = 79.6 days => October 2. I will be optimistic that 600M will likely be reached a bit before that. Useful details in this article:
"The Serum Institute of India, which manufactures Covishield, has raised monthly production to about 100 million doses.
The government says Bharat Biotech's monthly output will jump to as much as 70 million doses in July/August, from about 10 million doses in April. Production could rise further to nearly 100 million by September, it says."
""I expect the vaccine shortage to continue and as per the planned vaccine supply, it appears that the daily average for the whole of July will stay below 4 million," said Rijo John, health economist and a professor at the Rajagiri College of Social Sciences in the southern city of Kochi."
"The Indian government has ordered 660 million vaccine doses for August-December"
https://www.reuters.com/world/india/indias-daily-covid-19-infections-rise-by-38949-2021-07-16/

Took the vaccination rate from https://ourworldindata.org/covid-vaccinations, extrapolated using a simple polynomial trend line. Suggests hitting 600 million between 24th September and 1st October. Limited medical and broader infrastructure in developing countries probably constrains the more rapid vaccine roll-out seen in developed economies, though it's feasible. There continues to be global support for broadening out the roll-out and India has vaccine production in-country.

Last million took 25 days, average of 4 mil per day. This would get us to 25th September is.
Last 2 weeks have a higher average than month so there is potential to speed up. Giving outcomes a higher probability because of the need to scale up.
Achieving outcome1 would require 6m per day which might be a difficult increase to manage, particularly with additional 2nd doses.
